title: Exceptions no longer print file:line from where they were thrown

content.raw:
Prior to pull request #894, a `gzthrow` would print the file and line number in a console message, for example:
~~~
79: Exception [ODEJoint.cc:231] ODEHinge2Joint cannot be connected to the world
~~~
The switch to using `gzerr` in `Exception::Print()` means that `Exception.cc:52` is printed with every exception, which is not useful.
~~~
[Err] [Exception.cc:52] EXCEPTION: Unable to start server[bind: Address already in use]. There is probably another Gazebo process running.
~~~
We should use `std::cerr` instead of `gzerr` or figure out a way to use the correct file and line number.
